availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Darwin Elliott (Nelson county, Kentucky, attorney and clerk)

body.p: Nelson county, Kentucky, attorney and clerk. Kentucky native. Son of Lucinda Beal Elliot and William Elliot. Married Susan Carpenter Elliot in Bardstown, Kentucky on June 26, 1855. Father of Mary E. Elliot, Sam C. Elliot, Lucinda Abel Elliot, Louisa P. Elliot, Sarah Abel Elliot, Maggie Abel Elliot, and Lon Abel Elliot. Resident in Nelson County, Kentucky in 1850. Attorney in Bardstown, Nelson County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in 1860. Clerk of Nelson County c.1860. Enrolled for military duty in Fourth District of Kentucky on July 1, 1863 (U.S.A).

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 2, p. 748.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, Bardstown, p. 4.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, p. 127.
Find A Grave, "John Darwin Elliot (August 28, 1826- September 21, 1897)," Memorial #99886046, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/99886046 (accessed April 24, 2019).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Nelson County Courthouse, Bardstown, Kentucky, Nelson County Marriages, Film 001929414, p. 69.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Hardin County, KY, May 1865, p. 59, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
